section: Exercise 4.10.4: Scheduling meals at a school.
instructions: A school cook plans her calendar for the month of February in which there are 20 school days. She plans exactly one meal per school day. Unfortunately, she only knows how to cook ten different meals.
question:
(b)

How many ways are there for her to plan her schedule of menus if she wants to cook each meal the same number of times?
answer:
If she cooks each meal the same number of times, then she will cook each meal twice.
Number the meals 1 through 10. 
For j = 1 to 10, she selects the days in which she will cook meal j.
After she has selected the days for meals 1 through j, there are
20 - 2j days remaining from which to select the two days for meal j+1.
The total number of choices  is
